RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Claiming Purse 14500. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 8, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ALEXAPLAYBORNTORUN showed speed early and sent out for the lead, took control of the pace while saving ground, maintained comfortable fractions was able to go wire to wire. MAGGIE'S RETURN settled off the pace in hands early on, then started to gain ground and pain momentum after the half mile marker, continued to gain ground as she circled the field in the turn, set her sites on the leader and gamely tried to run ALEXAPLAYBORNTORUN down in the stretch but couldn't get there in time and too second place honors. SUMMER IS HOT broke and settled along the fence in a stalking position while being mid pack, saved ground and waws cued at the three eighths pole where she responded and starting gaining on the leaders, once she entered the stretch she started to drift out badly and ran flat. CUSTOM GUITAR was off a step slow, traveled out into the six path and stayed clear, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, circled the field through the turn and was driven into the stretch but to no avail. MOLLYS FLYIN HIGH stalked the early leaders from the three path, raced in between horses, edged out a bit at the half mile pole, and faded. MOODY RAFAELA stalked the leader from the four path, gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Summer Is Hot
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, rail, moved 3/8, drifted out in stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Mollys Flyin High
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked in between, 3w, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Custom Guitar
ENTRY.COMMENT: was off slow, raced 6-7w, circle the field in the turn, 7wupper

ENTRY.NAME: Alexaplayborntorun
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, attended pace, ground saving trip, raced gamely,

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Royal B. Kraft Sr. & Stacy Lynn Sliwinski

ENTRY.NAME: Moody Rafaela
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2nd tier, chased, faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Maggie's Return
ENTRY.OWNER: Haas Margaret Lanetta and Womack Larry D
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 6w, gained ground after 1/2,circled, missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 85. Claiming Purse 13000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MAY 8, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April 8, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CATHOLIC GUILT vied for the lead was able to take the lead and attend the pace while saving ground, and drew off in the stretch uncontested for the easy win. TURN ON THE MAGIC raced off the pace early while saving ground, angled out at the five sixteenth pole to launch bid, set sites on the leaders and was encouraged into the stretch and down the lane finished strongly but it was not enough today. MEDITATE stalked the leader from the three path until the middle of the second turn, launched a bid and challenged the leader leaving the turn, battled for a few strides and looked like a winner, then gave way in the stretch. TEMPRANO made no impact. WAR COUNT broke awkwardly and was not a factor. CROQUE MONSIEUR (GB) was no menace.

ENTRY.NAME: Turn On the Magic
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, saved ground, angled out 5/16, bid, closed, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Meditate
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 2nd tier, 3w, challenged, battled and tired

ENTRY.NAME: Temprano
ENTRY.COMMENT: made no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Catholic Guilt
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, set pace, drew away, won easily

ENTRY.NAME: Croque Monsieur (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: was no menace.

ENTRY.NAME: War Count
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke awkwardly

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 95. Allowance Purse 28000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, STATE BRED OR TRIAL OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 8 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Wh ere Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PRADO'S PRIORITY vied for the early lead and took control of the pace while racing from the three path, continued with pressure from a set on the inside, out ran that set and was met with a challenge from an outside bidder, was able to repel that rival and drew off gamely. LUNAR MODULE settled on a loose rein in the four path, was cued at the three eighths pole where he responded with a quick turn of foot was able to clear the rest of the field and challenged for the lead by the five sixteenth pole, battled into the furlong grounds but had no final kick and had to settle for second today. FIESTY FIST vied for the early lead and was pushed to stay forwardly placed, gamely raced in between to other foes driving for the lead, was not able to keep pace with the early leaders into the stretch, but maintained position for third through the rest of the race. HOSTILE AFLEET was allowed to settle of the pace while racing in the five path, was asked to move up at the half mile marker, continued to gain ground while still in the five path, built up momentum into the stretch, launched a bid at the quarter pole, where he found his best stride but had to much work to do. CREOLE CHARLIE hesitated at the start and made no impact. MORRICONE vied for the lead early was pushed to maintain forward positioning from the rail, and tired early.

ENTRY.NAME: Creole Charlie
ENTRY.COMMENT: hesitated at the start and made no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Morricone
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for the early lead, rail, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Fiesty Fist
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, sat off the leaders hip, willing raced in between, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Lunar Module
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled early on a loose rein, 4w, moved 3/8, chllngd, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Prado's Priority
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, took lead, 3w, pressured, repelled foe 1/4, drew off, game

ENTRY.NAME: Hostile Afleet
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke a bit slow, 5-6w, settled far back, found best stride late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 58. Claiming Purse 18000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over On The Turf Since April 8 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EAGLEOVERTHEMOON broke for the seven post position very sharply, was fast into the the first turn and had to go five wide, settled into a set of three at the six furlong pole, these three set the pace until the half mile marker, when EAGLEOVERTHEMOON shook one of the inside threats, she shook the other challenger at the three eights pole, where she drew off and dazzled with a brilliant performance for the win. CAJUN ACES matched strides in between two other competitors for the first half mile, while racing in the three and four path, kept on with the eventual winner until the three eighths pole then gave way. SHE'S TAKIN OVER stumbled terribly at the start, got herself balanced, was given time to find her stride while running along the rail, had a ground saving trip and was able to pass tired rivals in the stretch. SUE'S LITTLE ZING vied for the lead, pushed to maintain her forward position, hooked two other rivals for half of a mile tired. TRACK QUEEN raced mid pack, off the pace and faded in the stretch. GRAEME'S DEAL showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Sue's Little Zing
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, pushed along rail, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Track Queen
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, rail, faded in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: She's Takin Over
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled at the start, saved ground, passed tired ones

ENTRY.NAME: Graeme's Deal
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Cajun Aces
ENTRY.COMMENT: matched, gave way, chased

ENTRY.NAME: Eagleoverthemoon
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5w,1st turn, determined to lead, inside pressure, repelled, game

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 83. Allowance Purse 33000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE NOVEMBER 8, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 8, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs .
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NONEYA settled into the middle of the field very early on but then started gaining ground with every stride as she worked on the rail, took command by the half mile marker, continued to save ground and drew off in the stretch where she drifted out a bit but she was so much the best it did not make any difference, was able to win convincingly and put forth a game effort. LAKE MARIE vied for the early lead was sent and took command of the fractions until she was collared at the half mile marker by the eventual winner, continued to race with conviction but was second best today. CANADA'S CUSTOMS was off a bit slow, moved up into contention while in the four path, was ready to launch a bid going into the turn and had to check, then had no kick after that. DROP DEAD SEXY showed natural speed early on, raced in the four path willingly on a loose rein, maintained a forwardly placed position, was cued at the three eighths pole and launched a mild bid but to no avail. SPEEDY DUDETTE raced four wide and made no impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Noneya
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, rail, saved ground, moved up 1/2, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Lake Marie
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, sent, set pace, collared, second best today

ENTRY.NAME: Canada's Customs
ENTRY.OWNER: Heiligbrodt Corinne Heiligbrodt L William and Spendthrift Farm LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, raced in between, 4w, in contention1/2, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Speedy Dudette
ENTRY.OWNER: Salome Robert Joseph and Salome Dana
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Drop Dead Sexy
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed natural early speed, 4w, launched bid 3/8, no avail

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Purse 32000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 8, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KINGOFBROKENHEARTS settled off the pace and race near the back early from the six path, was encouraged to advance and responded with a nice turn of foot, through the turn and was kept to task through the stretch and was able to catch the early leaders late and take the win. AUTUMNS STRONG MAN raced off the pace from the four path, was challenged by rivals from the inside and outside, through the turn and into the deep stretch, where he repelled both of those challenges but was caught late by a rival closing on the far out side, had to settle for second best today but still ran a game race. CLEAR AS A BELE broke a step slow, angled out six wide, launched a wide bid and challenged for the lead, was in a four way battle but gave way in the stretch. FORTY THREE was off the pace early and ran even. TWO B vied for the early lead, set the first fraction along the rail, steadily faded after that. CHROMPTON was never involved. ORDER UP was mid pack ea, moved up into contention at the quarter pole and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Two B
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, set the early fraction, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Forty Three
ENTRY.OWNER: Roe Steve D and Roe Patricia L
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, ran even

ENTRY.NAME: Order Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace early, advanced and in contention at teh1/2, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Chrompton
ENTRY.COMMENT: was never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Autumns Strong Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 4w, battled, repelled, but second best today.

ENTRY.NAME: Clear as a Bele
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke a step slow, angled out 6w, challenged, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Kingofbrokenhearts
ENTRY.OWNER: Roe Steve D and Roe Patricia L
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off the pace early, gained ground

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 86. Claiming Purse 18000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 8, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $17,500, if for $15,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: REQUISITION stalked the early pace until the quarter pole where he launched a bid and was up for the win. PESO IN MY POCKET raced off the pace and wallowed to find his stride, was moved at the half and was in contention by the quarter pole,, launched abid but it wwas not enough today. HEZA PICKLE raced mid pack early, made a mild bid at the quarter pole. QUICK TO BLAME ran even. DUDE PERFECTA showed little. OXXON vied for the lead, maintained a forwardly placed position then tired in the lane. DARE TO FAIL was never involved. QUARTER RAT showed brief speed.

ENTRY.COMMENT: showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Quarter Rat
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief speed,

ENTRY.NAME: Oxxon

ENTRY.COMMENT: was never involved

ENTRY.OWNER: Riley Martin Scott Chris Carroll David and Latimer Frances
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, closed, up for the win

ENTRY.NAME: Peso in My Pocket
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, mid pack, in contention 1/4, not enough
